p: In an interesting parallel to viral infections, many genera of bacteria encode a type I TK, making them susceptible to antiherpesviral drugs. Imaging researchers have taken advantage of this property to visualize musculoskeletal infections, both in mice and in human patients. For example, a recent study employed 124I-FIAU as a PET probe to detect staphylococcal infections following joint surgery ( Fig. 9 ) ( Bettegowda et al., 2005, Diaz et al., 2007). The same approach has been used to image Mycobacterium tuberculosis in animals, even though the organism lacks its own TK. By introducing the gene for the Escherichia coli TK into a mycobacterial strain, researchers were able to use 125I-FIAU to visualize sites of infection by SPECT ( Davis et al., 2009).
